This webpage provides an overview of projects I have worked on over the course of my school years.

About Me

I am currently a student at the University of Delaware. I graduated from Delaware Technical Community College in 2019 and I am now pursing my bachelors degree in Computer Science with a concentraion in AI and Robotics. I plan to graduate during the Spring 2022 semester. During my years learning computer science I have worked with many different programming langauges these include:

  • C Langauge
  • Java
  • Python
  • SQL
  • Lisp
  • javascript

I have also learned many different topics in the computer science field these include:

  • Intro to Computer Vision
  • Intro to Data Mining
  • Intro to Machine Learning
  • Artificial Intelligence
  • Database Systems (Oracle SQL)
  • Parallel Computing
  • Data Structures
  • Logic Programing

Projects

I have worked on many school projects through my years here are a few:

Lisp Travel-Agent

  • A project from an AI course I took during the fall 2021 semester. The goal of this project is to find the shortest path to a goal city from the start using an A* algorithm.

Python-Computer-Vision Project 1

  • This project has two parts. Part A involves we must convolve, reduce, expand an image then use Gaussian Pyramid then use Laplacian Pyramids then reconstruct the image from Laplacian Pyramid. Finally, we blend the images together. Part B, an image is changed by doing a perspective transformation and an Affine Transformation.

Machine Learning Group Project

  • During the intro to Machine Learning course, we were given a final project where we were to pick any dataset from a web source and first present it to the professor on what we would need to do for the project, what may not work,and what machine learning method we would use.
  • We used a Bank Marketing data set that would predict an output based on 20 attributes with around 41,000 instances.
  • We found the accuracy of this dataset using two different approaches. The first we used pandas and sklearn python libraires. The second method used was numpy and pandas which was more built from scratch.

Simple BlackJack Game

  • This is simple blackjack card game written in C Langague.

Lisp-Decision Tree

  • Using common lisp a decision tree is made using an id3 algorithm from 100 datasets. Then subsets of the datasets can be created, classifed, and tested to see if they're classifed correctly. Then we use cross-validation to see the percent error

Future

My career plan after I'm finshed college is to find work in field that intrests me. I would love to work with anything related to AI, Machine Learning, or data minning. Other options that would intrest me would be working with database in programming langauges like oracle SQL or Postql. Also backend programming is something I enjoy as well.
